profileText: A Representative from North Carolina; born at ``Stag Park,'' near Wilmington, New Hanover County, N.C., ca. 1765; received a limited education; farmer; delegate to the North Carolina state convention, 1789; member of the North Carolina state senate, 1792-1793 and 1797; elected as a Federalist to the Fourth Congress to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of United States Representative Absalom Tatom (November 28, 1796-March 3, 1797); member of the North Carolina state house of representatives, 1801-1803; died in North Carolina in 1812; interment in a private cemetery on his estate at ``Hawfields,'' Orange County, N.C.

note.content: Elected to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of Absalom Tatom, and took his seat December 13, 1796.

researchRecord.name: In the Strudwick Family Papers, ca. 1771-1796, 0.5 linear foot.
researchRecord.description: Persons represented include William F. Strudwick.

parentRecordLocation.name: The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill Libraries
